hero.title: Legaline: how we launched a legal eCommerce platform in the UAE

sections.text: Legaline is an eCommerce platform that connects people and businesses with lawyers through a closed auction format: the user publishes a task, lawyers offer solutions and prices, and the client chooses the best. I joined the project as the chief designer when the product didn't exist yet.

There was only an idea, and a lot of questions: who needs it, in what format, what kind of pain are we solving, how will we differ in the overheated services market in the UAE. This is the story of how we turned an obscure hypothesis into a living product that quickly found its niche.

blocks.text:
Launching a new product is always a work in the fog. The UAE legal market is huge, but mercilessly chaotic: dozens of niches, hundreds of firms, thousands of freelance lawyers, and everyone has their own rules of the game.
We are facing several challenges:

- it is difficult for people to find a lawyer: There is no transparency, no prices, no understanding of who to trust
- lawyers spend a lot of time on cold applications, routine and haphazard negotiations
- the format of the "lawyers directory" is no longer working — the market is oversaturated
- there was not a single convenient platform based on the principle of "explain the problem → get solutions" in the region.

We understood that if we just made "another marketplace", the product would sink. We needed a niche that we would definitely get into — and a UX that could hold even an inexperienced user.

We have divided the work into several areas:

- research and niche search: understand which legal tasks are the most painful, how people seek help, who they trust, which payment models work, what they are afraid of and what they ignore.
- creating a brand and a style guide from scratch: to create a visual language that inspires confidence in the conservative legal field, but at the same time looks modern
- website development and advertising landing pages: create a funnel that explains a complex service in simple language and helps people formulate their problem
- creation of personal accounts: for three types of users, client → lawyer → law firm. Each with their own logic, scripts, subscriptions, and features
- a system of components for marketing: so that the team can launch dozens of campaigns and test hypotheses on real lawyers and clients.
Launching a product from scratch is always a path from ignorance to understanding. And this journey was very intense.

blocks.subtitle: Research: where is our entry point?
blocks.text:
I conducted a series of interviews with entrepreneurs, expats, lawyers, and representatives of legal firms.

It became clear very quickly:

- people don't understand exactly what service they need to order.
- lawyers hate "cold" applications where the client does not know what he wants
- most decisions are too bureaucratic or too expensive
- competitors don't explain the value — they just show catalogs

The main insight was simple and powerful: people don't need to choose a lawyer — they need a solution. And lawyers don't need to communicate with hundreds of random clients — they need to receive warm, understandable tasks. Hence the idea of a "closed auction" was born: the client writes a problem → lawyers give their options → the client chooses the best offer.

blocks.subtitle: Creating a brand and product language
blocks.text:
Legal products often look heavy, boring, and intimidating. We went the other way — we made Legaline modern, clean, and technologically advanced.

I created a stylegide:

- light typography
- strict geometry
- clear structure
- a calm palette
- a visual language of simplicity and trust.

This helped to remove the feeling of "legal bureaucracy" that many people hate.

blocks.subtitle: Main website and advertising landing pages
blocks.text:
We have made a website that explains the product in the first 10 seconds.
People should understand right away:

- What is it
- how the auction works
- what is the difference from freelance sites?
- what kind of security guarantees.

At the same time, I created a design system for landing pages - and the team started launching dozens of campaigns a week, testing niches: from migration issues to corporate law.

blocks.subtitle: Personal accounts of three types of users
blocks.text:
I designed the LC for:

- a client who wants to solve a legal problem quickly and safely
- a lawyer who participates in the auction, communicates with the client, and sends offers
- a law firm that needs to monitor employees, subscriptions, and applications.

Each office has its own logic and its own UX challenges.

Major improvements:

- simple application creation process
- clear auction structure
- convenient chats
- subscription system
- document management
- processing edge cases: cancellations, deadline violations, hiding personal data, secure payment.
The hardest part is making it as simple as possible.
So that a person who solves a legal problem in the UAE for the first time does not get lost.

Despite the fact that the product was created from scratch, the results exceeded the expectations of both the team and the market.

+34% conversion rate in the first contact with a lawyer
90% of successful auction completions
NPS 4.7 / 5 among the first users
Hundreds of lawyers registered in the first months
The legal platform has become a notable player in the niche
